title: Shaking
description: Shaking is an essential method for ensuring uniform mixing and, consequently, recording relevant metadata is crucial for maintaining consistent reaction conditions.Mechanically impelled mixing (stirring)

deflection.title: deflection
deflection.description: Information about the extent of deflection or bending of the agitator from its original position of the horizontal shaking system.

deflection_unit.title: deflection_unit
deflection_unit.description: Units such as mm (millimeters) or Î¼m (micrometers) could be used to describe deflection in relation to the movement of the shaking system.

position.title: position
position.description: Information regarding the orientation of the vessel in the shaking system relative to deflection.

shaking_type.title: shaking_type
shaking_type.description: The type of shaking used to mix the reaction (e.g., horizontal, vertical, back-and-forth or circulatory).

special_treatment.title: special_treatment
special_treatment.description: If there are any other specific methods, procedures, characteristics or aspects related to the shaking that are important for reproducibility and are not described by the aforementioned metadata, they      should be explained here.

speed.title: speed
speed.description: Specify the speed or frequency at which the shaking was conducted.

speed_unit.title: speed_unit
speed_unit.description: The shaking speed or frequency could be expressed in units such as rpm (rounds per minute) or Hz (cycles per second).
